page.title: 11POSTAL SERVICES
page.content: We went to the Post Office at Coberley to see Peter Grimshaw. He said that the post office was 107 years old and he showed us the original notice that used to be put in the window. It was written in quill pen. There was an old cabinet that was 80 years old and he showed us another valuable thing which was the scales. They were 100 years old with most of the original weights. He siad that one of the weights was missing. It had been stolen by a child who had come in to buy some sweets some time ago. He had a new one to replace it which was a modern one. It looked odd with the old ones. The post office has always been run by Mr. Grimshaw's family. He likes the old things in the shop and wants to keep the old character of the shop. He sells bottles of pop, sweets, bread that you have to order from the bakers
